author: Jens Knutson
comment: This is a great idea for an app, and it's done reasonably well, but the subscription is insane. They're not providing a service, they're just unlocking a feature and *renting* it to you.  No thanks.  I might have been willing to pay a fair amount to unlock the perfect buzz feature permanently, maybe 5 to 10 bucks, and that's a princely sum for an app that has to do so little.
title: Cool idea, but mediocre execution and CRAZY expensive subscription

author: Mark Strain
comment: On my Lg Watch r, in unable to edit the drink details. It just said "Failed!". Also, it takes some time to drink a drink so should I add the drink on ordering or on completion? I love the idea, looking forward to using it more but if you can help with my feedback that would be great.

reply.author: Appoxy
reply.content: Hi Mark, we'll take a look at the watch issue and get it fixed, sorry about that. And it would probably be best to add the drink while you're drinking it, but the results will be similar either way (unless you drink reaaaally slow). And remember, this is all estimations so it won't be your real BAC at any point in time anyways.

title: Great idea but...

author: Dan Beck
comment: Just downloaded it today to play with it a little. I have a Moto 360 and it's nice integration so you don't need to pull out your phone to enter drinks in case your phone isn't right there. The one thing I don't see that I'm able to do is see my BAC on the watch itself. I can enter drinks but if I want to see my BAC and time graph I need to pull out my phone. I don't know how difficult it would be to implement this but being able to see this info on a small watch screen instead of my phone would be a little more "discreet." Overall great app and I could see this helping to know when to say "no thanks" to the next round at happy hour! 4 stars now would make 5 if the additional data was on the watch.

reply.author: Appoxy
reply.content: It should notify you of your BAC every half hour on your watch, are you seeing those notifications?

title: Neat App

author: Richard Krahl
comment: Nice idea.  I have a moto 360 and I would love to see bac level on watch.  Also heart rate would be cool too.  See how the alcohol effects the heart would also play in to a more accurate bac count.  Maybe a motion detection on a per drink basis calculating sips per drink.  So much potential for this app.  Keep it coming.
title: Possibilities!!!!!

author: Taurence Salter
comment: Keeps telling me I need google play services installed, which I do.
title: Error

author: Mendell Alvarado
comment: Worthless. Doesn't work anymore. After reinstall, can't log in.

author: Indrani Dawn
comment: Can't sign up. Can't sign in. Can't connect watch. - Samsung Tablet

author: WILLIAM BAIN
comment: 5 stars! 1 for the idea, 1 for the effort and simplicity and 1 for the design, 2 stars are for the wear support and actual integration. I took 1 star off the initial 5 for no option to customise drinks and save them (there are different kinds of beers, wines, spirits, quantities and alc. %... 1 for the same thing via wear and 1 more for how buggy the wear implementation actually is. I am keeping 1 star on the side in good faith that the dev might fix these issues in no time. Keep up the good work.

reply.author: Appoxy
reply.content: Thanks for the feedback William! We've taken down all your comments so we can look into them. Can you provide more details on the buggy wear implementation? What issues are you having with it? Harsh star rating for a somewhat positive review! ;)

title: On a good path...

author: Matthew Anderson
comment: On top of that, it works with Android Wear allowing you to not only add a drink from your watch, but choose the type of drink.
title: Does exactly what it says

author: Bryan Poteet
comment: The units you chose do not translate to the units on the watch. Please fix to get a 4th star.

reply.author: Appoxy
reply.content: I've add this to the list, should get it fixed soon. Thanks!

title: Good start

author: Ron DesGroseilliers
comment: Version 1.5 is a great start.  Needs to let you adjust caloric amounts when they're shown to be off from actual amount.  Also, needs to let you add drinks and times when you missed entering earlier beverages.

reply.author: Appoxy
reply.content: Hi Ron, thanks for the feedback!  I've added your suggestion to our task list. You can already adjust the quantity and alcohol content of a drink so it does make sense to allow you to adjust the calories too.

title: Has the potential of being a "must-have" app

author: Travis Reeder
comment: And the app looks and works great.
title: Love it. Being able to track what I'm drinking is very enlightening

author: Stefan Tsekov
comment: Great application! 5 stars' performance and vision!

author: Stu Evans
comment: It's too difficult to use in reality. There is no branded list. It's a bit generic and there is so much difference between drinks it could really mislead you unintentionally. Good idea though.
title: Nice idea..

reply.author: Appoxy
reply.content: Are you saying you'd like to see a version optimized for your tablet?
